title: Gravity force - objects at corners of a square

content.question: Four identical objects, each of mass <math alttext="m sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>, are located at each of four corners of a square of side length <math alttext="d sub 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>. What is the magnitude of the gravitational force exerted on any one of the objects due to the other three?

choices.label: <math alttext="open parenthesis, one half plus the square root of 2, close parenthesis, times the fraction with numerator, G times m sub 0, end sub, squared, and denominator d sub 0, end sub, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><msup><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="open parenthesis, 1 plus the square root of 2, close parenthesis, times the fraction with numerator, G times m sub 0, end sub, squared, and denominator d sub 0, end sub, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><msup><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="five halves times the fraction with numerator, G times m sub 0, end sub, squared, and denominator d sub 0, end sub, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>5</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><msup><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="3 times the fraction with numerator, G times m sub 0, end sub, squared, and denominator d sub 0, end sub, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><msup><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open parenthesis, one half plus the square root of 2, close parenthesis, times the fraction with numerator, G times m sub 0, end sub, squared, and denominator d sub 0, end sub, squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>(</mo><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mo>+</mo><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><mo>)</mo></mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>G</mi><msup><msub><mi>m</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><msup><msub><mi>d</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
